channel.title: What language For me?
channel.description: Hello First thing My english is so badd exuse me =D, Hello I have a question About What language and Where to find : Tutorials, I Wanna make some "hackz"Just Tools Like mass msn Mailer, Mass buzzer For msn Ect, What Scripting language Is The Best for things like that. Plz help me advice Plz[br][size=1]Posted at: September 19, 2006, 02:05:52 PM[/size][hr]BTW : What operator is beter for "That" Linux or windows? If Linux* What Type? Plz Help Greetz Nap

item.title: What language For me?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:15, topic:15366”][quote author=1337h4x link=topic=22887.msg262273#msg262273 date=1158892399]
dude, just learn html. then javascript. then java. Gradually work youre way up.

That’s so you like understand concepts and stuff.
[/quote]
You honnestly don’t consider html and javascript to be coding languages do you? lol[/quote]
I think javascript most certainly can be a programming language…it doesn’t have the power and abilities of others, but it can definately do a lot. Your Grandpa’s right imo…a lot of javascript coding is not necessarily programming, but there are some really awesome JS classes out there I’ve seen.

And html is just a structural language, nothing more really.

Read full topic

item.title: What language For me?
item.dc:creator: @Your_Grandpa Your Grandpa
item.description:
@Your_Grandpa wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:15, topic:15366”][quote author=1337h4x link=topic=22887.msg262273#msg262273 date=1158892399]
dude, just learn html. then javascript. then java. Gradually work youre way up.

That’s so you like understand concepts and stuff.
[/quote]
You honnestly don’t consider html and javascript to be coding languages do you? lol[/quote]
Ever heard of AJAX? (Asynchronous JavaScript and XML)
alert(‘pmg i r h4x0r’); isn’t programming, but neither is cout << “pmg i r h4x0r” << endl;

Read full topic

item.title: What language For me?
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

maybe

no, just to get concepts. Html to like get used to the computer ( if you know how to use the computer skip it), javascript to get the concept of functions etc and java for a programming language.

Read full topic

item.title: What language For me?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Well, I don’t think you should be making to many things beyond very simple console applications if you haven’t made a single line of code in your life

Read full topic

item.title: What language For me?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:11, topic:15366”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=22887.msg261581#msg261581 date=1158868404]

He said something about MSN, so I assumed Assembly and C++'d do the trick.

Microsoft provides librarys with msn that can be very easilly used from visual basic
[/quote]I’d assume they have C++ and/or C# libraries as well?[/quote]
Thats possible, but they are easier to use in vb, especially when you haven’t made a single line of code in ur life before…

Read full topic

Golmit:

You know Some site for tutz For that “hackz” (A)??

But, start with vb, there is a good vb section at cruels.net with alot of tutorials (but don’t leave this place either ey :P)

item.title: What language For me?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Java is fun Does require reading. Linux and Windows are good for this.

You’ll probably get Visual Basic, so maybe that first. I’d do whatever you have the most resources to.

Now, for those ‘hacks’, I’d go to C++.

Read full topic
